g.text: Having in mind the astonishing achievements in the synthesis of new molecules of almost any shape
and sequences, there are no doubts that in the near future a great number of newsubstances will appear,
the properties of which are hard to imagine at the present time. The various types of orientational order
should be an essential feature of newly synthesized materials. Thus, the role of AXCCA as a unique
tool in X-ray studies of orientational order and angular correlations will only increase with time.
This research at UCSD was funded by U.S. Department of Energy, O
Energy Sciences, under Contracts No. DE-SC0001805. The research of R.K. and I.A.V. was funded by the Helmholtz
Associations Initiative and Networking Fund and the Russian Science, grant number HRSF-0002. The research of
B.I.O. was funded by the Russian Science Foundation, grant number 18-12-00108. The research of M.S. and F.S.
was funded by the DFG, grant numbers SCHE1905
The authors acknowledge support and discussions of the project with E. Weckert, and careful
reading of the manuscript by R. Gehrke.
The authors declare no conﬂict of interest.
Introduction to the Theory of Soft Matter
; Oxford University Press: New York, NY, USA, 2002.
